intro: Eriope tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly eriope, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Eriope tomentosa is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
